wikipedia_page.main: Samuel Batson Stevens (born 2 December 1935) is a Scottish retired professional footballer who played as a wing-half in the Football League for Southampton in the late 1950s.

response: After 145 games for the Saints, he was transfer listed in 1959 and moved on a free transfer to Poole Town, along with Southampton teammates Bryn Elliott, Sam Stevens and Barry Hillier. After a year with Poole, he moved to the Isle of Wight to join Cowes Sports starting a long association with the Cowes club, where he became manager in 1961, continuing to play until 1978.

Following his release, he played part-time for Poole Town of the Southern League (managed by former Southampton player Mike Keeping), along with Southampton teammates Pat Parker, Sam Stevens and Barry Hillier.
* Sam Stevens (actor), British actor in The Judas Gift
* Judge Sam Stevens, character in 5 episodes in 1968 in The Secret Storm, played by Terry O'Sullivan
